feed.title: The Guardian
feed.description: Latest international news, sport and comment from the Guardian

items.title: From Knives Out 3 to Soderbergh: 10 films to look out for at the Toronto film festival 2025
items.author: Benjamin Lee
items.description: Stars including Daniel Craig, Michaela Coel, Keanu Reeves and Channing Tatum to present latest films to big audiences

items.title: Just a pole and line, like they fished as boys: how a Maldives tradition is ensuring tuna stocks thrive
items.author: Maya Yang in Miladhunmadulu Atoll, Maldives
items.description: The country's fisheries and the health of its seas still rely on a method practised for nearly 1,000 years – catching skipjack tuna one fish at a time
items.content: The country's fisheries and the health of its seas still rely on a method practised for nearly 1,000 years – catching skipjack tuna one fish at a time

items.title: Conspiracies, costume changes, and three-hour deep dives into Twilight: inside the wild west of YouTube video essays
items.author: Kirsty Major
items.description: Mixing dense political ideas with allusions to The Sound of Music and BoJack Horseman, these films have become a thrilling DIY artform – one entirely conceived, written, filmed and performed by their stars
items.content: Mixing dense political ideas with allusions to The Sound of Music and BoJack Horseman, these films have become a thrilling DIY artform – one entirely conceived, written, filmed and performed by their stars

items.title: From bagpipes to borscht: exploring Edinburgh's Ukrainian heritage on foot
items.author: Zoey Goto
items.description: A new walking tour offers a chance to meet the city's Ukrainian community, with stops for hearty dumplings, castle views and shared histories
items.content: A new walking tour offers a chance to meet the city's Ukrainian community, with stops for hearty dumplings, castle views and shared histories

items.title: No Abba, no meatballs? Sweden's new cultural canon is a listicle that will soon be forgotten | Gabriel V Rindborg
items.author: Gabriel V Rindborg
items.description: We should always be suspicious when states try to define a national culture – especially when the arts are in crisis
items.content: We should always be suspicious when states try to define a national culture – especially when the arts are in crisis

items.title: Catch a break: surf adventures in the California sun – in pictures
items.author: Guardian Staff
items.description: Surfer Todd Weaver takes magical pictures of the Golden State – from ombre skies reflected in the sea to crashing waves and rising full moons
items.content: Surfer Todd Weaver takes magical pictures of the Golden State – from ombre skies reflected in the sea to crashing waves and rising full moons

items.title: Lisbon funicular crash: Portugal declares day of mourning as death toll rises to 17
items.author: Sam Jones in Madrid, Helen Livingstone and agencies
items.description: More than a dozen people killed and 21 others injured after one of city's famous streetcars derailed
items.content: More than a dozen people killed and 21 others injured after one of city's famous streetcars derailed

items.title: Israeli military database indicates only a quarter of Gaza detainees are fighters
items.author: Emma Graham-Harrison and Yuval Abraham in Jerusalem
items.description: Elderly woman with Alzheimer's, medical workers and children among 6,000 Palestinians held

items.title: Trump asks US supreme court to overturn trade tariffs ruling
items.author: Julia Kollewe
items.description: Move follows federal appeals court decision that sweeping 'liberation day' levies on imports had overstepped presidential powers
items.content: Move follows federal appeals court decision that sweeping 'liberation day' levies on imports had overstepped presidential powers

items.title: Spain and Portugal wildfire weather made 40 times more likely by climate crisis, study finds
items.author: Ajit Niranjan Europe environment correspondent
items.description: Wildfires were 30% more intense than would have been expected without global heating, scientists say
items.content: Wildfires were 30% more intense than would have been expected without global heating, scientists say
